Comment: Article makes the interesting legal point that the 8th amendment bars "cruel and unusual *punishment*" not treatment.   So claiming that deporting people to El Salvador isn't "punishment" for anything they did wrong, rather it's a measure to keep the US safe -- this makes it harder to claim deportations violate the 8th.  If they actually had a conviction, it would be easier to argue for the 8th.   Of course I'm sure these nuances are lost on Trump but he does still have a few monsters on his side who know the law and this is likely part of what's keeping the deportations and detentions in El Salvador going.
